Description: A long string of fifty amulets amulets: of various materials, five beads and four pendants. The beads are all of glazed composition: the conical bead, mis-shapen barrel and oblate bead are all green, and two short barrels are blue. Three pendants are drop-shaped and made of cornelian, blue-green glazed composition and amethyst. The fourth is a flattened wide drop of amethyst. Of the three baboon amulets two are of amethyst and one of cornelian. There are two green feldspar and three amethyst hawk amulets, two green jasper turtle amulets, one green feldspar 'ba'-amulet and two couchant lions,' one of steatite, the other of ivory. The string is completed by five hands, two fists, six hornets, four leg-with-foot amulets, three faces, four 'wedjat'-eyes, one shell-shaped amulet, one hippopotamus' head, one Taweret and one indeterminate amulet, all of cornelian.
Curator's comments: The forms and material of some of the amulets suggest that they are Middle Kingdom in date. For baboon amulets, see W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Amulets’ (London, 1914), pl. XXXVII, 206; G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' II (London, 1927-30), pl. XCIV, class 14; Earl of Carnarvon & H. Carter, 'Five Years' Exploration at Thebes, 1907-11' (London, 1912), pl. XLVI. For hawk amulets, see W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Amulets’ (London, 1914), pl. XLI, 245l-q; R. Engelbach 'Harageh' (London, 1923), pl. L; Earl of Carnarvon & H. Carter, 'Five Years' Exploration at Thebes, 1907-11' (London, 1912), pl. XLVI, 2G: but cf. too G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' II (London, 1927-30), pl. XCVII, 45P3: First Intermediate Period. For commentary on 'ba'-amulets, see W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Amulets’ (London, 1914), pl. XXXIII, 185e-h: Petrie calls these amulets female sphinxes with cat bodies; H. Junker, ‘Bericht über die Grabungen der Akademie der Wissenschaften in Wein auf den Friedhöfen von el-Kubanieh-Nord. Winter 1910-11’ (Vienna, 1920), pl. 10, group 80, 13.m.3; E. R. Ayrton, C. T Currelly and A. E. P. Weigall, ‘Abydos’ III (London, 1904), pl. XII, group 2; T. E. Peet, ‘The Cemeteries of Abydos, part II. 1911-12’ (London, 1914), pl. X, groups 9, 10; W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Diospolis Parva: the Cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. 1898-9’ (London, 1901), pl. XXVII, group W 38; Earl of Carnarvon & H. Carter, 'Five Years' Exploration at Thebes, 1907-11' (London, 1912), pl. XLVI, 2F: all Middle Kingdom.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (269)
